Spent my day returning calls & emails from people having problems filing for unemployment. I fully understand their frustration. I know Oregon Employment Department is overwhelmed, but they have to get this right. 

People need help now!

Our frontline health care workers need PPE now. There's no time to waste.

We must close the gap with paid leave policies & higher wages!

Americans need a coordinated, whole-of-government response to provide healthcare and economic security during the #COVID19 pandemic.

While we work to inform & empower people to use the bill, we must start working on what comes next in a recovery package that builds on and expands on the recovery of our economy and strengthens the healthcare system.

Today’s package is a welcome sign to the hundreds of thousands of Oregonians I represent who are worried about staying healthy, keeping their job, and paying their bills. 

This bill is by no means perfect, but it's immeasurably better than the Senate’s initial bill.

We have been hit hard by #COVID19. We must provide front line physicians w/ resources to keep people safe. https://t.co/eoZPsjM0U3
@drearosef We have been working with the State Department to do just that.  Will keep the pressure on until we get them home.

I am so grateful for the surge of solidarity I've witnessed from Portlanders looking out for each other. To support those efforts, my team and I have compiled Portland metro area resources into a spreadsheet, which we will be updating regularly: https://t.co/yzzaAHrpjK

States are rightly delaying in-person voting, but we shouldn't have to choose between public health and participating in our democracy. 

That's why I'm fighting alongside @RonWyden to allow for mail-in voting during public health crises like #COVID19

This is as confusing a time as we've ever been in.

It's important to remain calm, resilient, and aware.

When faced with challenges like this, our social responsibility is heavier. It falls on everyone in our community to act responsibly so we all remain healthy and safe.

Throughout it all, let's also remember to show consideration and empathy for those on the front lines keeping daily life together.

Health staff, grocery store workers, those in the service industry: you are appreciated.

We also need a temporary employee retention tax credit for businesses that keep their employees.

We need to make it as easy as possible for workers to keep their jobs, and for businesses to stay afloat. The federal government needs to do its part to stabilize our economy.

We need:

✅UBI of 1K per month to adults to combat lost wages

✅Direct funding to local businesses so they can pay employees

✅Expanded unemployment insurance to cover up to 12 months, eliminate wait periods & work search mandates

✅Moratorium on student loans and evictions

Congress passed a comprehensive relief package that aims to support the most impacted groups, but we cannot repeat the mistakes of the past and enrich those at the top.

I'm going to share some of the things I'm fighting for.

This country is entering one of the most tumultuous economic periods in our history. While we must prioritize public health, I'm working on a plan to help workers and local businesses fight back against the economic damage being done by #COVID19

We should do this now! #UBIStimulus 
https://t.co/b1BdzhYXOX

These Oregon-based physicians have a plan to mitigate the spread and consequences of #COVID19. I hope this administration will listen and take action.

https://t.co/CPWNDyMHXi
RT @AOC: On the election end, @repblumenauer & @RepDonBeyer are pressing state governments to come up with plans for election continuity to…
It is critical we all know the facts and what we should do. Oregonians should stay updated with the latest information on the Oregon Health Authority website: https://t.co/BhkgIctBbD 15/15
-The federal government should pay for emergency food and nutrition services for our most vulnerable populations, including school meals and meals for low-income older adults. 14/15

-Protect the courageous people keeping our communities safe. Frontline public health workers and those in contact with people that have been exposed should all have the equipment and protective gear they need. 13/15
-Provide comprehensive child care as more schools and daycare centers close as a result of the virus. 12/15

-Employers must also be required to provide paid sick leave, available immediately, in the event of a public health emergency. This includes missing work when your child’s school is closed or if you or a family member is quarantined or isolated as a result of the outbreak. 11/15

-Protect small businesses by reimbursing the costs of providing 14 days of additional paid sick leave. Hard hit small businesses should be able to provide their employees protections without going bankrupt. 10/15

-For those unemployed as a result of #COVID19, I’m working to secure benefits that would be available through the end of 2020 and can be paid retroactively. Importantly, Social Security trust funds must be held harmless. 9/15
-Increase in federal funds for Medicaid as states face increased costs. 8/15
-Flexibility for food assistance programs to stop the employment requirements to receive assistance, as well as emergency food for local food banks to meet increased demand. 7/15
-Halt student debt collections and provide relief while we deal with economic challenges brought on by #COVID19. 6/15
-A moratorium on evictions that could result from #COVID19. 5/15
-Emergency paid family and medical leave programs that cover up to three months of pay, as well as increased unemployment compensation that is accessible for all workers. 4/15

This is what we need: 

-Free #COVID19 testing for everyone who needs a test, including the uninsured, regardless of income. 3/15

Among my main concerns are Oregonians who work in hourly wage jobs, the service industry, and the gig economy that are going to be hit very hard by this crisis. 

Time and money are scarce, and we cannot afford to waste either. 2/15

With all of the uncertainty surrounding #COVID19, I want to make sure you know what I’m fighting for in Washington D.C. 

There are some lessons I hope we have learned from other crises of the last two decades, like 9/11 and the 2008 financial crisis. 1/15

Paid family and medical leave should be guaranteed. 

In the midst of a global health crisis, this should be common sense, and it will make a huge difference stabilizing the economy.

I voted against its extension today. I will continue working to reform this harmful program.

It’s time for @senatemajldr to stop stonewalling & allow a vote. https://t.co/V1mubZo8th

Congress is taking this seriously and dedicating the resources necessary to beat this crisis. 

We will be successful in keeping people safe, but events like this also sadly illustrate our second-rate executive leadership & the need for universal health care.

Yesterday I worked alongside others in the delegation to secure CDC funding to help fight the coronavirus in Oregon. The House and Senate also passed a funding package double what the Trump administration proposed to fight the virus nationwide.

Voting should be easy, convenient & accessible to all. HR1 included my Oregon provisions like #VoteByMail & #AutomaticVoterRegistration. @senatemajldr must allow a vote on this bipartisan legislation. The individual right to vote is the cornerstone of a representative democracy.

As one of only 10 states w/ paid sick leave, in Oregon it's likely that you lawfully have the right to stay home & still be paid if you're unwell. If you think you're being denied that right, visit https://t.co/tyNHUoh0IG

Don't risk it—we all play a role in staying healthy.

Being a part of @repjohnlewis 80th birthday surprise party was the highlight of my day. Happy birthday, friend.

"Be hopeful. Be optimistic. Never lose that sense of hope."-John Lewis https://t.co/w8pyEJ2XlX

One of the silver linings of the past few years is the persistence and energy of grassroots groups, led by women, fighting for change across the nation. Their ability to shine a spotlight and organize around critical issues has made a profound difference. https://t.co/3FfwMFPBuo

Today’s reelection kickoff was energizing! Our campaign is strong w/over 6,000 contributions of $50 or less, dedicated volunteers, dozens of house parties, & a community of enthusiastic supporters joining me in the fight to maintain the House & win back the Senate & White House. https://t.co/jlY8lCF9A6

Despite what @realdonaldtrump says #coronavid19 is not a hoax. @OHAOregon recommends that you wash your hands often w/soap & water for 20 sec, cover coughs & sneezes w/a tissue, avoid touching your face, clean & disinfect surfaces, & stay home if you are sick. For info, call 211. https://t.co/IUKEBXzlEA

This crisis will prove to be an indictment of not only our executive leadership (or lackthereof), but our health care system as a whole. 

No more "Go Fund Me" health care. We need quality, affordable care—period. 

We need Medicare for All.

Trump has dismissed the severity of the coronavirus, cut budgets that would fund the response, & passed the responsibility to a man who has a track record of failed public health leadership. 

Now we hear stories of people being billed for care to keep the virus at bay.

In our own back yard in Oregon, ICE is detaining people without court ordered subpoenas and arresting mothers and fathers in sensitive community locations. 

I'm working in Congress to ban this type of deplorable behavior. ICE must end their invasive assaults on families.

Two Portland heroes - Keanon Lowe and Ricky Best - have been been nominated for the Congressional Medal of Honor Society's Citizen Honors Award. Their courage and sacrifice not only saved lives, but courageously showed us that hate will never win.  https://t.co/EMjsDbRccK

Pedestrian & cyclist deaths have gone up dramatically over the past decade. We must put an end to senseless roadway fatalities. 

Congress needs to pass my Vision Zero Act to create a safer and more equitable future.

Negligent. 
Irresponsible.
Idiotic.

Trump admin refuses to sign worldwide Vision Zero pact because “climate change, gender equality, reduced inequalities, [&] responsible consumption and production are not related to road safety." 

News flash: they are.

Oregon State Republicans walking out days before the climate bill even reached the floor, putting at risk other bipartisan measures and the work of the Senate, is a whole new level of social irresponsibility. #DoYourJob #NoMoreCostlyWalkouts

Today’s anti-abortion votes in the Senate were part of a calculated and deliberate attack on reproductive rights. If Mitch McConnell and the @GOPSenate actually cared about women's reproductive health, they'd provide more access to care, not less.
Not that @JoAnnPDX needs me to stand up for her (she is one of the strongest people I have ever met), but we all need to speak out against racism and sexism. We are all in this together.

A heat wave in #Antarctica melted 20% of an island's snow in 9 days.

We simply cannot ignore the #ClimateEmergency any longer. The planet is sending a clear message. 

My resolution declares the climate crisis an emergency. Bold action is not an option—it's a necessity.

All the new housing doesn't matter if the people who need it most are forced to spend another night on the streets. That's why I've introduced a bold plan to address this epidemic. It's time for a big change, for a new deal in housing the likes of which our country has never seen https://t.co/jBXG2mxL7S

I reintroduced legislation to put an end to oil companies escaping their responsibility to clean up after tar sand oil spills. Amidst the growing #ClimateEmergency, this is a small step. It’s critical to hold Big Oil accountable at every point & protect our communities.
Job well done! https://t.co/lg3QBvop9T

Proud to stand with @sunrisemvmt and sign the Green New Deal Pledge. I helped write the #GreenNewDeal and have been a supporter since it was introduced. Congress must declare a #ClimateEmergency and pass the Green New Deal now! https://t.co/syZxe0Y7Se

From Multnomah Falls, to Crater Lake, to the Wallowas, we are enchanted by Oregon's beauty. On a day that so many celebrate love and affection, let's also take time to celebrate the beautiful place we call home. Happy 161st birthday to the Beaver State! https://t.co/EoSxEcIpHq

Women’s equality is not a partisan issue. I voted to remove the deadline for the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment and I urge @SenateGOP to do the same. We must ensure that equal rights for women are included in the Constitution. #ERANOW

#CadetBoneSpurs (Trump) suggesting that decorated military officer Lt. Col. Vindman be investigated under oath while he continues to hide behind a corrupt DOJ is another costly consequence of the Republican Senate letting him off the hook.

The prosecutors that stepped down in protest to Trump's Twitter demands in the Roger Stone case are the true patriots. 

The DOJ has become a political tool for Trump to use as he pleases. He is destroying our institutions and democracy in plain sight.

Trump's budget proposal clearly illustrates his painfully misguided priorities. Extravagant military spending undercuts real national security concerns. 

We should invest in the American people, who actually contribute to our strength. We must fight back & defend our values.

Workers have been increasingly stripped of their rights; resulting in stagnant wages, widening income inequality, & unsafe workplaces. 

The House just passed the most comprehensive labor reform legislation in 80 years. We must keep fighting for the American workforce. #PROAct https://t.co/WjXF5wS0Ps

Senate Rs now go into their election cycle tarnished by the shameless abdication of their duty. The facts remain the same: Trump compromised nat’l security, obstructed Congress, & violated the Constitution. 

This sham trial is ending today, but Trump will be impeached forever.

It will be a time of celebration not just of a new administration but of a new beginning that reaffirms and builds on American values, what worked in the past, and what Americans want.

This next SOTU will only happen if we all do our part this year to make it possible. #SOTU
There is a long, important list of programs that will unite our citizens, save money, and improve the economy and the environment

Next year, we will not have a tiresome litany of divisive issues that create new problems and make existing challenges worse, but instead focus on areas of agreement, progress that will bring us together instead of dividing us.

We will reaffirm that diplomacy is the first line of defense to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons and to promote peace in the Middle East, not creating impossible situations, which make us all less safe and true progress toward peace more tenuous.

Finally, the new president will declare that America is going to resume its rightful role as a global leader, not attacking our allies in trade or foreign policy, but instead working with them against countries that are challenging us, like China.
We will decriminalize cannabis, increase research that will save lives, and support communities that have been ravaged by this failed war on drugs.
The next president will reaffirm the commitment to civil rights for all and fight for everyone to be able to vote and have that vote protected from interference, either domestic or foreign.

Americans will no longer be forced to pay twice as much for mediocre health care. It starts by making sure prescription drug price reform employs simple principles of competition, lowering skyrocketing costs.
The next administration will announce an end to the war against the Affordable Care Act and instead build and strengthen it, moving rapidly to expand health care to all!
We will roll back the largest tax giveaway in history to wealthy individuals and corporations to restore tax fairness and equity.
The new president will unequivocally defend reproductive rights and everyone's right to control their own body.

They will announce an aggressive program to eliminate unnecessary loopholes that contribute to income inequality and exploding deficits while ensuring the richest Americans and special interests pay their fair share.

Instead of cutting funds to help solve our housing crisis, the next POTUS will announce the federal government is getting back in the game and will partner with local communities with housing-first policies.
The time of enabling and sending dog whistles to white nationalists will be over. Our next president will lead by moral example and return and expand our human decency.
Our country will at last stand up to the NRA and pass public safety measures to protect our communities from gun violence.
We will no longer lock kids in cages and, instead, will eliminate the cruelty of ICE and pass comprehensive immigration reform that respects the humanity and dignity of all.
The new president will not only protect Social Security but will also expand it and eliminate the cap on contributions.
In doing so, we will not only make our families safer and stronger, we will also create hundreds of thousands of family-wage jobs.

The principles of the Green New Deal will be employed concurrently along with the implementation of the Democratic plan to rebuild and renew America in a way that's sustainable, low carbon, and promotes resilience in our communities.
We will reinstate important policies ensuring our communities have access to healthy food and providing it to all our children at little to no cost, so they are healthy and ready to learn.

Instead, the federal government will lead by example by protecting those special places, embarking on an aggressive program of regenerative agriculture which can actually take carbon out of the atmosphere.

A bold call as we rejoin the Paris Climate Agreement to put teeth in our policies.

We will stop unjustified, wasteful, and destructive subsidization of the fossil fuel industry from our public lands.
The next State of the Union should focus not just on the existential threat to our way of life and to the planet, but on what will be done to protect the planet and our families
Rather than dignify Trump's parade of boasts, lies, and puffery with my presence, I instead am focusing on what the next State of the Union will be like if we all do our part. #SOTU2020

I will #BoycottSOTU, but the crowd will be filled w/ people impacted most by Trump's policies & McConnell's shameful inaction. I gave my ticket to Michelle Freedman, a tireless advocate for lower Rx prices. Her experience is why we're fighting to improve the #StateOfHealthCare

It's evident we need the Oregon model nationwide. 

The House passed my bill last year to require paper ballots, but the Senate is getting in the way of keeping our elections safe and secure. 

We need #PaperBallotsNow!

The #IowaCaucusDisaster clearly demonstrates why we should never solely rely on technology, which is often unreliable & insecure, to safeguard our democracy. 

Luckily, paper ballots are saving the day.
Learn more at: https://t.co/5IjBGlRrbi

Each new item uncovered makes it harder for Republicans to justify their denial and their rush to judgment. 

In the closing hours of this trial, Bolton has another chance to finally serve his country responsibly.

The Bolton disclosures are exactly why I led the effort to hold the articles & not rush them to the Senate. 

This additional time allowed for more information to come out, with likely more damning revelations on the way. 

This could change the landscape of the Senate trial.

The theme of the event: WE WON'T GO BACK! https://t.co/N7IAyU0DHi

47 years ago #RoevWade made a woman's right to choose law of the land. 

We must keep fighting to make sure it stays that way.
Guilty. https://t.co/tzpZoFjL8y

An emotional day celebrating the legacy of Dr. King with so many champions of racial progress here in Portland. Many vivid memories and a reminder of so much we have yet to do. #MLKDay https://t.co/Nyvgx5Y8Yh

With today's @EnergyCommerce hearing, another major cmte has focused time & attention on our movement to bring federal cannabis policy into the 21st century & end the failed war on drugs. This was an encouraging step on our blueprint to legalize cannabis, but we need more action.

The wine industry is responsible for thousands of jobs in Oregon. These nonsensical tariffs would have a devastating impact on Oregon wine industries, restaurants & small businesses. We cannot punish American industry through irresponsible trade retaliation. I'm fighting back. https://t.co/soH97hpDEx

Caught up with @rahnamepting before the @USProgressives Caucus meeting yesterday. 

From @nextuporegon to @MoveOn, she has always been an incredible progressive organizer. The fight continues! https://t.co/QGOHPRogF6
Stopped by the @MoveOn #NoWarWithIran rally before casting my vote to assert the War Powers Act to prevent war with Iran. https://t.co/RmQThv3pa3

I'm working alongside @RepRoKhanna, @RepBarbaraLee & @USProgressives to bring their legislation to the floor to restrict funding for military action in Iran & repeal the 2002 AUMF. 

In the interest of national security, it's critical that we take up these bills immediately.
Congress must be resolute in retaining its authority to intervene & keep us from yet another dangerous, pointless war. #NoWarWithIran

Iran’s attack against U.S. forces tonight is a predictable reaction to Trump’s reckless decision to assassinate Soleimani. There is a reason why past presidents didn’t make such a careless move, which is now pushing us to the brink of war.
RT @PramilaJayapal: We need everyone in the streets. Trump has put us in this position with his military brinksmanship. We must de-escalate…

Once again, Trump's lifetime of lying & bullying has collided with the reality of being president. His impulsive action over the last week has put America & the prospect of peace in the Middle East at serious risk.

The House is doing its job.

Senate Republicans need to step up.

Starting by withdrawing from a treaty that Iran had honored, Trump has now launched us on a reckless program of brinkmanship with Iran. 

In the interest of national security,  Congress needs to reassert its constitutional responsibility here.

The passing of @CommishFish is a profound shock. Nick was a dedicated public servant who continued his service as he waged a courageous battle against cancer. We honor that service as we mourn his loss. My deepest sympathy to his family.
